subject: Support Common-Sense Hemp Regulation - Not Prohibition
body:
Dear Representative {repName},

My name is {userName}, and I am {userIdentity}. I urge you to support common-sense hemp regulation during the upcoming special sessionâ€”not another attempt at prohibition.

Governor Abbott's veto of SB 3 sent a clear message: he heard and understood Texans want regulation, not a ban. The hemp industry has pushed for age restrictions for the past three sessions and supports consumer safety. However, a ban would only:

- Eliminate 53,000+ Texan jobs
- Fuel a black market of truly unregulated products
- Eliminate $2.1B in wages and $267M in tax revenue
- Strip responsible adults the freedom to access to the wellness products they rely on

I ask that you support legislation that:

- Sets age restrictions for purchases (21+)
- Requires robust testing and labeling standards
- Mandates child-resistant packaging on consumable products
- Establishes reasonable setbacks from schools and daycares
- Holds bad actors accountable without punishing compliant businesses
- Respects Texans' right to choose hemp products for health and wellbeing

Texans across the political spectrum support a regulated hemp market. Please listen to your voters and back balanced policies that promote safety, protect small businesses, and reflect the will of the people.

Sincerely,
{userName}
